definition: (onom.) clang/clank of metal/sound of striking a gong
(coll.) tram, especially Beijing trams during period of operation 1924-1956/also written 噹噹車|当当车[dang1 dang1 che1]

sentences.english: The shields and swords that hung on the walls rattled against each other.
sentences.chinese: 壁上挂的剑，盾相互撞击，铛铛作响。

sentences.english: The clang of the firebell alarmed the village.
sentences.chinese: 的铛铛声惊动了全村的人。

definition: Dongdong, cheerleading mascot of 2008 Beijing Olympics
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
child's buttocks (esp. Cantonese)/(onom.) crack, slap, clap, clatter etc
sharp and clear/crisp/melodious/ringing/tinkling/silvery (of sound)/fragile/frail/also written 輕脆|轻脆
(onom.) to squeak (of mice)/to chirp or peep (of small birds)
